hero_subtitle: Automate bulk AI video & image generation on Google Flow
hero_desc: Auto Flow is a Chrome extension that supercharges Google Flow with batch processing, queue management, multi-resolution downloads, and a smart gallery system. Generate hundreds of AI images and videos with just a few clicks.
feature_modes_desc: Create Image, Text-to-Video, Frame-to-Video, Ingredients, Nano Banana Pro
feature_queue_desc: Multi-job queue with retry, reorder, inline settings
cp_desc: The control panel is your command center. Four mode buttons let you switch between generation types instantly. Select a mode, enter your prompts, and start generating.
cp_create_image_desc: Generate AI images using Nano Banana Pro. Supports reference images.
cp_t2v_desc: Batch generate videos from text prompts using Veo 3.1.
cp_f2v_desc: Upload images as first/last frames for video generation.
cp_ingredients_desc: Combine ingredient images with video prompts for product showcases.
ci_desc: Generate AI images in bulk using Nano Banana Pro. Enter one prompt per line, or separate multi-line prompts with a blank line.
ci_prompts_desc: Type or paste your prompts into the text area. Each line is treated as a separate prompt. For multi-line prompts, separate them with a blank line. You can also import prompts from a .txt file.
ci_ref_select: Select images — Persistent reference images used across all jobs. Great for maintaining consistent character styles.
ci_ref_onetime: One-time upload — Images used only for the current job, then discarded.
ci_ref_bulk: Bulk mode toggle — When ON, maps one image per prompt in line order. Image 1 pairs with Prompt 1, Image 2 with Prompt 2, etc.
t2v_desc: Generate videos from text prompts in batch. Enter one prompt per line in the text area, select your model and settings, then add to queue.
t2v_aspect_desc: Choose between 16:9 (landscape) for YouTube/desktop or 9:16 (portrait) for TikTok/Reels/Shorts.
t2v_repeat_desc: Generate N videos per prompt (1–4). Useful for creating variations and picking the best result.
t2v_tip: Use 9:16 for TikTok/Reels content. Most viral short-form video is in portrait orientation.
f2v_desc: Upload images as starting or ending frames, then Auto Flow animates them into videos using your text prompts. The Frame-to-Video control panel has several input sections.
f2v_prompts_sample: "Sample .txt file" link — Download a sample prompt file for reference
f2v_prompts_import: "Import file (.txt)" button — Import prompts from a text file
f2v_queue_select: "Select queue images" button — Upload images to the queue (separate from the reference library)
f2v_queue_onetime: "One-time queue upload" button (lightning icon) — Upload images for a single job, then discard them
f2v_queue_help: Help button (?) — Tooltip explaining how queue images work
f2v_queue_bulk: Bulk queue mode toggle — "One image per prompt (line order)." When ON, Image 1 pairs with Prompt 1, Image 2 with Prompt 2, etc.
f2v_queue_first_prompt: Use first prompt for all uploaded queue images toggle — When ON, all queue images use the same first prompt instead of individual prompts
f2v_reflib_add: "Add to library" button with expand/collapse chevron — Add new reference images to your persistent library
f2v_reflib_hint: Frame hint — "1st image = First Frame, 2nd image = Last Frame (optional)"
f2v_reflib_grid: Library thumbnail grid — Shows all saved reference images as thumbnails
f2v_reflib_actions: Select all / Clear selected / Delete selected refs buttons — Manage your reference library in bulk
f2v_reflib_count: Selection count — Shows how many reference images are currently selected
f2v_textarea_desc: Enter your prompts in the text area. Each prompt is separated by a blank line. A single prompt can span multiple lines or be a JSON-formatted prompt. Example:
f2v_map_toggle: Checkbox toggle — Enable to assign specific reference images to individual prompts
f2v_map_stats: Stats display — Shows "N prompts · N refs active · N custom mapped"
f2v_map_grid: Mapping grid — Paste prompts first to map references. Shows "Paste prompts first to map references." as placeholder.
f2v_map_count: Mapped count + Hide — Shows number of mapped references with a Hide toggle button
f2v_btn_add: Add to Queue — Large green/teal CTA button. Adds the current prompts and images as a job to the queue.
f2v_btn_manage: Manage (N) — Opens the queue management modal. Shows the count of queued jobs.
f2v_warning: Make sure the number of images matches the number of prompts when bulk mode is ON. Mismatched counts will cause errors.
i2v_desc: The Image → Video workflow is Auto Flow's most powerful feature. It lets you generate images first, pick the best ones, then animate them into videos — all in one automated pipeline.
i2v_step1_desc: Write prompts with [V#-S#] tags and ||| delimiter
i2v_step2_desc: Run Create Image mode to generate all images
i2v_step3_desc: Browse gallery, pick best images for each scene
i2v_step4_desc: Send selected images to Frame-to-Video queue
i2v_step5_desc: Automation uploads images + prompts to Flow
i2v_format_desc: Use this format for each scene — the ||| delimiter separates the image prompt from the video prompt:
i2v_rule_1: Each VIDEO gets a unique V# (V1, V2, V3...) — do NOT use V1 for everything
i2v_rule_2: The [V#-S#] tag must appear on BOTH sides of the ||| delimiter
i2v_rule_4: Separate video groups with a blank line for readability
i2v_rule_5: The image prompt describes what to GENERATE (still image)
i2v_rule_6: The video prompt describes how to ANIMATE it (motion, audio, dialogue)
ing_desc: Combine product ingredient images with video prompts for showcase videos. Upload ingredient images, add your video prompts, and Auto Flow handles the rest.
ing_step1: Upload your ingredient or product images
ing_step2: Write video prompts that describe how to animate each product
ing_step3: Add to queue — Auto Flow pairs images with prompts and generates videos
gal_desc: Your generated content is automatically collected in the gallery. Browse, select, download, and send images directly to the video pipeline.
gal_overview: The gallery has two main tabs — Images and Videos — each with their own set of controls for browsing, selecting, and exporting your generated content.
gal_img_intro: The Image Gallery tab displays all generated images in a browsable grid. Use the toolbar controls to manage your content:
gal_img_subtabs: Images / Videos sub-tabs — Switch between viewing generated images and generated videos
gal_img_layout: Layout toggle — Switch between Default (compact grid) and Large (bigger thumbnails) views
gal_img_resolution: Resolution dropdown (1K) — Select the resolution for scanning and display
gal_img_scan_all: Scan All (yellow/highlighted button) — Scans the Google Flow page for all generated images. This is the primary way to populate the gallery.
gal_img_import: Import Images — Import images from your local computer into the gallery
gal_img_sort: Sort dropdown (Default) — Sort images by different criteria
gal_img_count: Image count — Displays the total number of images found
gal_img_select: Click images to select them (checkmark overlay appears)
gal_img_random: Random Pick — Randomly select images from the gallery. Useful for quick variety when you have many generated images.
gal_img_matched: Pick Matched — Automatically select the best-matched images for each prompt. Smart selection based on prompt-image pairing.
gal_img_download_btn: Download (N) — Download all selected images at the chosen resolution (1K instant, 2K/4K upscaled)
gal_img_animate: Animate Images — Send selected images to the Frame-to-Video queue for animation. This is the key Image-to-Video bridge that connects the image pipeline to video generation.
gal_img_howto: "How to use" expandable section — Built-in guide within the gallery for quick reference
gal_vid_grouped: Videos are grouped by prompt for easy browsing
gal_vid_layout: Layout controls — Same Default/Large layout toggle as the image gallery
gal_vid_select: Selection & batch download — Select multiple videos and download them all at once
gal_vid_tip: 4K video downloads are serialized — only one upscale processes at a time. Be patient!
gal_wf_1: Generate images or videos using any mode (Create Image, Text-to-Video, etc.)
gal_wf_3: Click "Scan All" to populate the gallery with your generated content
gal_wf_4: Browse and select the best results
gal_wf_5: Download at your desired resolution, OR
gal_wf_6: Click "Animate Images" to send selected images to the video pipeline
queue_desc: The queue system lets you stack multiple generation jobs and run them back to back. Monitor progress, reorder priorities, and handle failures gracefully.
queue_adding_desc: Select your mode, enter prompts, configure settings, then click "Add to Queue". Jobs are added in order and can be rearranged before starting.
queue_dl_folder: Job Download Folder — Text input with auto-incrementing folder name (e.g., "Auto-Flow-08"). Sets where the output for each job is saved.
queue_manage_btn: Queue manage button — Opens the full queue modal to view, reorder, and manage all jobs
queue_autostart: Auto-start next job in queue — Toggle to automatically begin the next job when the current one completes
queue_progress_bar: Progress bar — Visual progress indicator showing completion percentage
queue_progress_status: Status — Shows current state (Ready, Running, etc.) with a checkmark icon when complete
queue_modal_desc: Open the queue modal to view all jobs and their current status:
queue_action_front: Move to front — Prioritize a job to run next
queue_action_reset: Reset — Re-run a completed job from scratch
queue_action_delete: Delete — Remove a job from the queue
queue_action_redo: Redo selected — Pick specific prompts within a job to retry
queue_action_inline: Inline settings — Edit model, aspect ratio, and repeat count before running
queue_failed_count: Failed count — Shows the number of tasks that have failed
queue_failed_empty: Placeholder — Shows "No failed prompts yet." when there are no failures
queue_failed_copy: Copy Failed Prompts/Images button — Copies all failed prompts to your clipboard for quick re-entry
queue_failed_retry: Retry Failed button — Creates a new job from all failed prompts and adds it to the queue
queue_failed_autoretry: Auto retry failed until 0 checkbox — Automatic retry loop that keeps retrying failed prompts until none remain. Maximum 12 retry rounds.
queue_autoretry_tip: The "Auto retry failed until 0" feature is great for overnight batch runs. It will keep retrying failed prompts automatically (up to 12 rounds) so you don't have to babysit the queue.
set_desc: Fine-tune Auto Flow's behavior to match your workflow. Access settings from the gear icon in the control panel.
set_gen_vids_per: Videos per task — How many videos to generate per prompt (dropdown: 1–4)
set_gen_vid_model: Video Model — Veo 3.1 Fast (Lower Priority), Veo 3.1 Quality, or Veo 2
set_gen_imgs_per: Images per task — How many images to generate per prompt (dropdown: 1–4)
set_gen_img_model: Image Model — Nano Banana Pro (Default), or other available models
set_gen_start_from: Start from (Prompt/Image) — Skip to a specific prompt number. Useful for resuming interrupted jobs.
set_timing_wait: Video creation wait time (min/max seconds) — Random wait between min and max after each generation
set_timing_humanized: Humanized mode (experimental) — Adds random delays to simulate human browsing behavior
set_timing_speed: Typing speed (humanized) — Slider from 0.5x to ~3.0x controlling how fast prompts are typed. Renamed from "Humanized speed" for clarity.
set_dl_auto_vid: Auto-download videos — Toggle on/off + "Configure folder" link to set download destination
set_interface_lang: Language — Dropdown with 14+ language options for the full interface
set_sub_status: Subscription status — Shows your current plan (Free or Pro)
set_sub_signin: Sign in / Upgrade — Sign in with your email via magic link, then upgrade to Pro
set_maintenance_cache: Clear Flow Cache — Red-bordered button that clears cached data on the Flow page. Use this when generation stops working or the page gets slow. Does NOT affect your downloaded files.
set_maintenance_tip: Only use Clear Flow Cache as a last resort when generation stalls or the page becomes unresponsive. It resets the extension's state on the current page.
set_guide_links: Guide links — Quick links to the user guide in Tiếng Việt and English (this page)
set_discord_link: Discord community — Join the Auto Flow Discord for support, tips, and feature requests
set_tip: Turn off "Ask where to save each file before downloading" in your browser's download settings for seamless auto-downloading.
sub_desc: Auto Flow offers a Free tier and a Pro tier. Compare what's included:
sub_how_desc: Sign in with your email via magic link in the Subscription section, then upgrade to Pro. Daily quotas reset at midnight UTC.
faq_desc: Frequently asked questions about Auto Flow.
faq_a1: Policy violations are the most common cause. Some content types are restricted by Google Flow's content policy. Try rephrasing your prompt to avoid potentially flagged terms. Also check that your prompts don't exceed the character limit.
faq_a2: Make sure you're on a Google Flow project page (labs.google.com/fx/), then click the Scan All button. Images auto-populate during generation, but Scan All will pick up any that were missed.
faq_q3: Can I use Auto Flow on multiple devices?
faq_a3: Yes, with Pro. Your subscription is linked to your email account, so you can sign in on any device. Free tier usage is tracked per device.
faq_a4: The ||| delimiter separates image prompts from video prompts in the Image → Video workflow. Everything before it describes the still image to generate, and everything after describes how to animate it.
faq_a5: Veo serializes upscaling — only one video upscales at a time on Google's end. This is a platform limitation, not an Auto Flow issue. 720p downloads are instant since no upscaling is needed.
faq_q6: The extension isn't detecting the Flow page
faq_a6: Make sure you're on labs.google.com/fx/ and the Chrome sidepanel is open. Try refreshing the page. If the issue persists, disable and re-enable the extension in chrome://extensions.
faq_a7: Open the Subscription section in Settings, sign in with your email (you'll receive a magic link), then click Upgrade. Your Pro access activates immediately.
faq_a8: Humanized mode adds random delays between actions (800–3000ms) to simulate natural browsing behavior. Adjust the speed with the slider — lower values mean longer delays. Useful if you're experiencing rate limiting.
tips_desc: Power-user tips to get the most out of Auto Flow.
tip_1: Use bulk mode for efficient image-per-prompt batching
tip_2: Set up reference images for consistent character style across scenes
tip_3: Queue multiple jobs before pressing Start — they'll run back to back
tip_4: Enable auto-download + auto-start for fully hands-off operation
tip_5: Use [V#-S#] tags to keep multi-scene videos organized
tip_6: Lower the typing speed multiplier if you're getting rate limited
tip_7: The Gallery persists across queue restarts — your generated content won't disappear
tip_8: Use 9:16 portrait for TikTok, Reels, and Shorts content
tip_9: Use Scan All in the gallery if content isn't appearing after generation
tip_10: Redo selected lets you retry specific prompts without re-running the whole job
patch_intro: Auto Flow has evolved into a full-featured AI content studio. Here's what's been added since v7.7.7:
patch_1: Frame-to-Video mode — upload images as first/last frames for video generation
patch_2: Reference Library — persistent image library with bulk management across all jobs
patch_3: Queue Images — separate upload system with one-time queue upload option
patch_4: Map references by prompt — assign specific reference images to individual prompts
patch_5: Bulk queue mode — one image per prompt in line order
patch_6: Smart Gallery with auto-populated images and videos from generation
patch_7: Random Pick & Pick Matched — intelligent image selection tools
patch_9: Animate Images — send gallery images directly to the video pipeline
patch_10: Multi-job queue system with auto-start, reorder, and inline settings
patch_11: Auto retry failed until 0 — automatic retry loop (max 12 rounds)
patch_12: Auto-download for both images and videos with configurable resolution
patch_13: Full settings panel — models, ratios, timing, downloads, language
patch_14: 14+ language support for the entire interface
patch_15: Discord community for support and feature requests
patch_16: Clear Flow Cache — maintenance tool for when generation stalls
